                                <div class="fs12px pbot0 clearfix">
                    <a href="https://www.zomato.com/review/rDZLM" class="grey-text">
                        <time datetime="2013-06-28 13:37:15" itemprop="datePublished">Jun 28, 2013</time>
                    </a>

                                        	                    
                </div>
            </div>

                            <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text mbot0 " itemprop="description" tabindex="0">
                    <div data-iconr="ô" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-3" title="Poor" aria-label="Rated 2.0">Rated</div> 
                                            The leading marquee when it comes to vegetarian food, Saravana Bhavan has been suceessful in making sure you think of it when you want to relish idlis, vadas, dosa. uthapams etc...The ambience and service is very no-nonsense-forget-the-niceties types so don't expect to have your chair pulled back while you're seated or having spic and span tables when you're seated. <br />
The food is tasty but the serving quantity is bad and could leave you hungry for more.<br />
And then the prices....you just cannot justify the prices and so this is a big let down.<br />
Conscious that I may be committing sacrilege to quite a few folks out there...but to me Saravana Bhavan is one big hype of a place.<br />
Ambience 2.5/5<br />
Service : 3/5<br />
Taste : 4/5<br />
Price: 1/5<br />
VFM : 2/5
                                                            <div class="clear"></div>
                </div>

          </a>

    <div class="content col-l-11 large-snippet ml5 mt5">

      <div itemprop="name" class="header nowrap ui left">
                  <a data-entity_id="887983" href="https://www.zomato.com/users/sripathy-raagav-887983">
            Sripathy Raagav
          </a>

      <span class="grey-text fontsize5 nowrap">

                        
                                            5 Reviews

                          1 Follower
                                          
              </span>

                              <div data-is-followed="" data-user-id="887983" data-entity-type="USER" class="zs-follow-btn-container usr-page-follow-btn clear mt2">
                <a class="social-button follow-social cgrey ui basic large label ui-label-bb zs-follow-user-button" aria-label="Follow" role="button">Follow</a>

                                <div class="fs12px pbot0 clearfix">
                    <a href="https://www.zomato.com/review/gBnLY" class="grey-text">
                        <time datetime="2013-06-10 20:18:51" itemprop="datePublished">Jun 10, 2013</time>
                    </a>

                                        	                    
                </div>
            </div>

                            <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text mbot0 hidden " itemprop="description" tabindex="0">
                    <div data-iconr="ó" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-2" title="Poor" aria-label="Rated 1.5">Rated</div> 
                    To start with I'm a big fan of Saravana Bhavan. But with deep regret, I'm writing this review. This comment is restricted only to this branch of Saravana Bhavan. <br />
<br />
One should not visit this place between 3 PM till 6 PM. This is time when Saravana Bhavan sells the non-standard quality stuff. Me and my friend ordered two plates of 'hot idli' - as they say in the menu. Whereas we got almost COLD idli. Patiently, I requested the waiter to change the idlis. The next plate was not so cold as the previous one. Next we ordered, 'On the go Salad" and Chilli Parotta. Salad was fine. But I have had such a worst chilli parotta in my lifetime. It was so hard and very tough to eat. We both were starving, so without complaining we had that parotta also. Then we ordered one dosai and ice cream to finish the meal. We were really shocked to see the bill amount of Rs. 700 plus. Honestly I was not ready to pay the whole bill. We met the hotel manager and he spontaneously told us to pay the whole since we had consumed the food. We were trying to explain to the manager that we were starving and that is why we had to eat and we already exchanged one plate of idli. The hotel manager who was never "customer friendly", didn't even ask an apology for the dish being so poor. Finally, I paid the bill without any mind to pay it. This was one my very bad experiences in hotels. <br />
<br />
My only comment to Saravana Bhavan is "Don't loot money from people by giving damn poor service and quality..."
                                        <div class="clear"></div>
                </div>
                <div class="rev-text-sm mbot0">
                    <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text-expand " tabindex="0">
                        <div data-iconr="ó" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-2" title="Poor" aria-label="Rated 1.5">Rated</div>

<div itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope="" itemprop="review" style="display: block;">

    <span itemtype="http://schema.org/Restaurant" itemscope="" itemprop="itemReviewed" style="display:none">
        <span itemprop="name">Hotel Saravana Bhavan, Anna Nagar West, Chennai</span>
    </span>

    <div data-res_id="65499" data-snippet="restaurant-review" data-review_id="212385" class="  ui segments res-review-body res-review clearfix js-activity-root   item-to-hide-parent stupendousact">
        <div class="ui segment clearfix  brtop ">
            
            <div class="ui warning message error-message-highlight review-message hidden mbot"></div>

            <div class="ui item clearfix ">
                                <div class="item">
                    <div class="clearfix  mb10 ">
                        <div itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope="" itemprop="author" class="res-large-snippet ui horizontal list col-s-16  ">

  <div class="item col-s-16">
    <a href="https://www.zomato.com/vijaysrivatsan">
            <img data-original="https://b.zmtcdn.com/data/user_profile_pictures/37e/835c9979c43b9021cdd0704bdf68d37e.jpg?fit=around%7C100%3A100&amp;crop=100%3A100%3B%2A%2C%2A" src="https://b.zmtcdn.com/images/placeholder_200.png" alt="Vijay Srivatsan" class="ui avatar image left tiny" />
          </a>


<!--      -->

    <div class="content col-l-11 large-snippet ml5 mt5">

      <div itemprop="name" class="header nowrap ui left">
                  <a data-entity_id="342318" href="https://www.zomato.com/vijaysrivatsan">
            Vijay Srivatsan
          </a>
                
      </div>
                <div class="clear"></div>

      <span class="grey-text fontsize5 nowrap">

                        
                                            166 Reviews
                                ,
                          2129 Followers
                                          
              </span>
        <div class="clear"></div>

                              <div data-is-followed="" data-user-id="342318" data-entity-type="USER" class="zs-follow-btn-container usr-page-follow-btn clear mt2">
                <a class="social-button follow-social cgrey ui basic large label ui-label-bb zs-follow-user-button" aria-label="Follow" role="button">Follow</a>
            </div>
          
                      </div>

  </div>
</div>

                    </div>
                </div>
                                <div class="fs12px pbot0 clearfix">
                    <a href="https://www.zomato.com/review/AAbkR" class="grey-text">
                        <time datetime="2013-06-01 15:39:01" itemprop="datePublished">Jun 01, 2013</time>
                    </a>

                                        	                    
                </div>
            </div>

                            <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text mbot0 hidden " itemprop="description" tabindex="0">
                    <div data-iconr="ø" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-6" title="Good" aria-label="Rated 3.5">Rated</div> 
                    I've had a long standing relationship with Saravana Bhavan since the last decade and a half. Yes, you heard that right, Saravana Bhavan's Anna Nagar branch has been around for almost 15 years. I've seen the place begin as a non-nonsense, almost blue-collar type restaurant to it's current state boasting 4 types of restaurants including ones for buffets, multi-cuisine and a roof-top.<br />
<br />
This was also the place where I had savored North-Indian and Chinese cuisine for the first time as a kid, but it's been long since I had grown, so has Saravana Bhavan and the food scene in Chennai. But enough with the nostalgia, nowadays there are way better places to have North-Indian and Chinese cuisine than Saravana Bhavan (one thing I've learned the hard way recently), but there's no question that they're still the big name when it comes to South-Indian cuisine, especially the "tiffin" variety.<br />
<br />
You really can't go wrong with the South-Indian food here, there's nothing I can specifically point to or recommend as a specialty, because everything here is good in equal measure. The coffee too is a must-have and it's known to find itself in most top-ten filter-coffee lists originating in Chennai.<br />
<br />
The service is nothing special but it's prompt, the ambience is almost always hustling and bustling, and during peak hours you might find people peering over your shoulders expecting you to finish your meal as soon as possible. How people still manage to crowd this place irrespective of the stratospheric prices still baffles me. This isn't a place I'd recommend to you to visit with friends or family if you want to have a quiet conversation, but if a quick lunch or an early breakfast is in schedule, this is the place to be. Talking about early breakfast, Saravana Bhavan opens as early as 06:30 am, finding huge patronage with the morning-walker's community.<br />
<br />
To wrap things up, do not try the Chinese cuisine here at any cost, it's seriously not worth it. Saravana Bhavan is the place to be if you want simple South-Indian fare, their quality and cleanliness is something I highly value and appreciate. I still find myself grumbling about the ridiculously high prices, but I couldn't help but visit this place every other week with my family; hell, we even know some stewards and waiters personally. Yes, it's that good... All a South-Indian vegetarian like me needs is good Sambar and excellent coffee, something this place dishes in spades...
                                        <div class="clear"></div>
                </div>
                <div class="rev-text-sm mbot0">
                    <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text-expand " tabindex="0">
                        <div data-iconr="ø" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-6" title="Good" aria-label="Rated 3.5">Rated</div> 
                        I've had a long standing relationship with Saravana Bhavan since the last decade and a half. Yes, you heard that right, Saravana Bhavan's Anna Nagar branch has been around for almost 15 years. I've seen the place begin as a non-nonsense, almost blue-collar type restaurant to it's current state boasting 4 types of restaurants including ones for buffets, multi-cuisine and a roof-top.<br />
<br />
This was also the place where I had savored North-Indian and Chinese cuisine for the first time as a kid, but it's been long since I had grown, so has Saravana Bhavan and the food scene in Chennai. But enough with the nostalgia, nowadays there are way better places to have North-Indian and Chinese cuisine than Saravana Bhavan (one thing I've learned the hard way recently), but there's no question that they're still the big name when it comes to South-Indian cuisine, especially the "tiffin" variety.<br />
<br />
You really can't go wrong with the South-Indian food here, there's nothing I...
                                                    <a href="#" class="read-more">read more</a>
                                                <div class="clear"></div>
                    </div>
                </div>

<div itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope="" itemprop="review" style="display: block;">

    <span itemtype="http://schema.org/Restaurant" itemscope="" itemprop="itemReviewed" style="display:none">
        <span itemprop="name">Hotel Saravana Bhavan, Anna Nagar West, Chennai</span>
    </span>

    <div data-res_id="65499" data-snippet="restaurant-review" data-review_id="177032" class="  ui segments res-review-body res-review clearfix js-activity-root   item-to-hide-parent stupendousact">
        <div class="ui segment clearfix  brtop ">
            
            <div class="ui warning message error-message-highlight review-message hidden mbot"></div>

            <div class="ui item clearfix ">
                                <div class="item">
                    <div class="clearfix  mb10 ">
                        <div itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope="" itemprop="author" class="res-large-snippet ui horizontal list col-s-16  ">

  <div class="item col-s-16">
    <a href="https://www.zomato.com/vineshkoka">
            <img data-original="https://b.zmtcdn.com/data/user_profile_pictures/f89/3ab2e9034f2aa2cb078fe7c6b6d9af89.jpg?fit=around%7C100%3A100&amp;crop=100%3A100%3B%2A%2C%2A" src="https://b.zmtcdn.com/data/user_profile_pictures/f89/3ab2e9034f2aa2cb078fe7c6b6d9af89.jpg?fit=around%7C100%3A100&amp;crop=100%3A100%3B%2A%2C%2A" alt="Vinesh Koka" class="ui avatar image left tiny" style="display: block; opacity: 0.237413;" />
          </a>


<!--           <a href="https://www.zomato.com/verified" target="_blank">
        <i class="corner star blue icon link verified-profile-small" data-variation="inverted" data-title="Zomato Verified Reviewer"  data-content="We have met and verified this user. Click to know more about verified profiles." ></i>
      </a>

    <div class="content col-l-11 large-snippet ml5 mt5">

      <div itemprop="name" class="header nowrap ui left">
                  <a data-entity_id="103242" href="https://www.zomato.com/vineshkoka">
            Vinesh Koka
          </a>

      <span class="grey-text fontsize5 nowrap">

                        
                                            342 Reviews
                                ,
                          2590 Followers
                                          
              </span>
        <div class="clear"></div>

                              <div data-is-followed="" data-user-id="103242" data-entity-type="USER" class="zs-follow-btn-container usr-page-follow-btn clear mt2">
                <a class="social-button follow-social cgrey ui basic large label ui-label-bb zs-follow-user-button" aria-label="Follow" role="button">Follow</a>

  </div>
</div>

                    </div>
                </div>
                                <div class="fs12px pbot0 clearfix">
                    <a href="https://www.zomato.com/review/RkBkb" class="grey-text">
                        <time datetime="2013-04-18 23:14:50" itemprop="datePublished">Apr 18, 2013</time>
                    </a>

                                        	                    
                </div>
            </div>

                            <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text mbot0 hidden " itemprop="description" tabindex="0">
                    <div data-iconr="ö" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-5" title="Average" aria-label="Rated 3.0">Rated</div> 
                    I usually know better than to order North Indian and Chinese from a place that's called Saravana Bhavan. However, since the restaurant boasts of having more branches outside India (40+) than within India (33), and the menu is like a mini novel with pages and pages of multicuisine fare, I thought it was only right to evaluate how valid their boast was. And I was right - it was a hollow boast! South Indian is all you should order here. Just skip the rest.<br />
<br />
They have about 4 floors - the topmost being rooftop garden and the 3rd floor being the buffet area. We ate in the 2nd floor - the ambiance was alright (imagine a South Indian tiffin place hustling and bustling with activity - only, this place is a little more spacious than that). There is almost always a 15-20 minute wait... minimum.<br />
<br />
FOOD<br />
Very Good: Onion Rava Masala Dosa, Appam with Coconut Milk, Plain Dosa<br />
Average: Idly, Mutter Paneer, Rumaali Roti, Vegetable Spring Roll<br />
Bad: Mixed Veg Parotta, Gobi Mushroom Fry<br />
<br />
My wife is so tired of eating Karnataka saambaar (which she calls "sweet") and she loves this restaurant's saambaar. She loved it this time, too, but I actually found it a bit extra salty. Maybe my taste buds have embraced Karnataka's sweet saambaar, I don't know.<br />
<br />
The prices are where it gets really ugly. I think they are terribly overpriced - Rumali Roti for Rs.52, Plain Dosai for Rs.65, Rava Masala Dosai for Rs.107, Appam for Rs.80, Idli Sambar for Rs.94, and so on. Even filter coffee is Rs.38. Works out to Rs.275 per person.<br />
<br />
My final word is that Hotel Saravana Bhavan is one of those many places where the reputation/hype exceeds the offering. And if I went back, I'll totally stick to the South Indian tiffin items.
                                        <div class="clear"></div>
                </div>
                <div class="rev-text-sm mbot0">
                    <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text-expand " tabindex="0">
                        <div data-iconr="ö" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-5" title="Average" aria-label="Rated 3.0">Rated</div>

And I was right - it was a hollow boast! South Indian is all you should order here. Just skip the rest.<br />
<br />
They have about 4 floors - the topmost being rooftop garden and the 3rd floor being the buffet area. We ate in the 2nd floor - the ambiance was alright (imagine a South Indian tiffin place hustling and bustling with activity - only, this place is a little more spacious than that). There is almost always a 15-20 minute wait... minimum.<br />

Average: Idly, Mutter Paneer, Rumaali Roti, Vegetable Spring Roll<br />

                                <div class="fs12px pbot0 clearfix">
                    <a href="https://www.zomato.com/review/mPBnR" class="grey-text">
                        <time datetime="2013-01-31 10:04:15" itemprop="datePublished">Jan 31, 2013</time>
                    </a>

                                        	                    
                </div>
            </div>

                            <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text mbot0 " itemprop="description" tabindex="0">
                    <div data-iconr="õ" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-4" title="Average" aria-label="Rated 2.5">Rated</div> 
                                            Overpriced and overrated. Heard a lot about this place and decided to take my in-laws for an evening of Chennai delicacy. The food was nothing special. You get pretty much the same quality of dosas anywhere in India. As for the ambience, it's difficult to enjoy your food if you have two families standing over your shoulder waiting for you to finish. Service was prompt. Felt like I was paying too much but I guess that had a lot to do with my expectations walking into the place.<br />
Never went back to the place. Don't plan to go back in the future as well.
                                                            <div class="clear"></div>
                </div>

                            <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text mbot0 " itemprop="description" tabindex="0">
                    <div data-iconr="ù" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-7" title="Very Good" aria-label="Rated 4.0">Rated</div> 
                                            Hotel Saravana Bhavan, Annanagar is known for its unmatched quality.<br />
<br />
Well this is the place where i almost drop in everytime to relish their IDIYAPPAM.<br />
<br />
1.High Quality Food<br />
2.Best sambar ever to be made<br />
3.Chola Batura at its best<br />
4.IDIYAPPAM lip smacking<br />
<br />
The restaurant is the best place for elderly people to sit and relish south indian delicacies :)

<div itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope="" itemprop="review" style="display: block;">

    <span itemtype="http://schema.org/Restaurant" itemscope="" itemprop="itemReviewed" style="display:none">
        <span itemprop="name">Hotel Saravana Bhavan, Anna Nagar West, Chennai</span>
    </span>

    <div data-res_id="65499" data-snippet="restaurant-review" data-review_id="84491" class="  ui segments res-review-body res-review clearfix js-activity-root   item-to-hide-parent stupendousact">
        <div class="ui segment clearfix  brtop ">

            <div class="ui item clearfix ">
                                <div class="item">
                    <div class="clearfix  mb10 ">
                        <div itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope="" itemprop="author" class="res-large-snippet ui horizontal list col-s-16  ">

  <div class="item col-s-16">
    <a href="https://www.zomato.com/sankalp2277">
            <img data-original="https://b.zmtcdn.com/data/user_profile_pictures/207/e6b55794e3a67855511b25a9f4442207.jpg?fit=around%7C100%3A100&amp;crop=100%3A100%3B%2A%2C%2A" src="https://b.zmtcdn.com/images/placeholder_200.png" alt="San2277" class="ui avatar image left tiny" />
          </a>


<!--           <a href="https://www.zomato.com/verified" target="_blank">
        <i class="corner star blue icon link verified-profile-small" data-variation="inverted" data-title="Zomato Verified Reviewer"  data-content="We have met and verified this user. Click to know more about verified profiles." ></i>
      </a>
     -->

    <div class="content col-l-11 large-snippet ml5 mt5">

      <div itemprop="name" class="header nowrap ui left">
                  <a data-entity_id="301505" href="https://www.zomato.com/sankalp2277">
            San2277
          </a>
                
      </div>
                <div class="clear"></div>

      <span class="grey-text fontsize5 nowrap">

                        
                                            198 Reviews
                                ,
                          2983 Followers
                                          
              </span>
        <div class="clear"></div>

                              <div data-is-followed="" data-user-id="301505" data-entity-type="USER" class="zs-follow-btn-container usr-page-follow-btn clear mt2">
                <a class="social-button follow-social cgrey ui basic large label ui-label-bb zs-follow-user-button" aria-label="Follow" role="button">Follow</a>

  </div>
</div>

                    </div>
                </div>
                                <div class="fs12px pbot0 clearfix">
                    <a href="https://www.zomato.com/review/XnLeB" class="grey-text">
                        <time datetime="2012-10-20 19:19:45" itemprop="datePublished">Oct 20, 2012</time>
                    </a>

                                        	                    
                </div>
            </div>

                            <div style="line-height: 20px;" class="rev-text mbot0 hidden " itemprop="description" tabindex="0">
                    <div data-iconr="ù" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-7" title="Very Good" aria-label="Rated 4.0">Rated</div> 
                    Chennai or Madras is one of the few conservative and traditional cities of India. I had a long relation with Chennai since my childhood. Along with my parents I used to stopover at our family friends and relatives in Chennai, Coimbatore and Ooty. Later on it was during my working days in Chennai, I resided in Anna Nagar. I used to visit different restaurant every weekend to taste different cuisines in Chennai. I love traditional Madrasi and Chettinad style of cooking. <br />
<br />
Saravana Bhavan is a pure vegetarian food joint started in 1981 and still going on. They serve every kind of food from south indian, north indian and chinese be it breakfast, snacks, lunch or dinner. Every weekend my breakfast was only at Saravana Bhavan only. This is one among the best places to have Idly with sambar and coconut chutney. I don't know how many people know the fact that Saravana Bhavan is one among the first hotel to introduce centralised kitchen concept. Due to which the taste of every dish remains the same both in quality and authenticity. Feeling the pulse of the customer they introduced new concepts which were never known and have been the formula for their success. <br />
<br />
Saravana Bhavan used everything made in-house. Everything from the Tiffin's, meals, bakery items to lip smacking ice cream has been made in-house. They even added Saravana Dairy rich Ice cream and Fresh Bakes division to their existing range of offerings. They were the first restaurant groups to introduce their own brand of ice cream and bakery products which are sold at Hotel Saravana Bhavan.<br />
<br />
Hotel Saravana Bhavan on Anna Nagar is really huge and everyone and anyone depending on their budget can get food available here. I had been to all the levels in this hotel to taste the food at different restaurants but you must be really surprised the quality is maintained. <br />
<br />
I must say anyone once had food here, would definitely revisit to quench their thirst for authentic and traditional food. The ambiance is good and the surrounding is always kept clean and tidy. The waiters are always on their toes to serve the customers. Parking is not an issue and pricing will suite everyone's wallet.  I wish they continue their good work and satisfy every customer.<br />
<br />
Ambiance 4.5/5<br />
Food Quantity 5/5<br />
Food Quality 5/5<br />
Pricing 4.5/5
                                            <br /><br /><a target="_blank" href="https://www.zomato.com/spoonback?u=http%3A%2F%2Fsankalpfoodie.blogspot.in%2F&amp;r=84491&amp;to=301505&amp;k=64332822b6fcf605e12c373f7fd8c859"><span class="left red-text">sankalpfoodie.blogspot.com</span><span data-icon="ŧ" class="grey-text left ml5"></span></a>
                                        <div class="clear"></div>
                </div>
                <div class="rev-text-sm mbot0">

                        <div data-iconr="ù" class="ttupper fs12px left bold zdhl2 tooltip icon-font-level-7" title="Very Good" aria-label="Rated 4.0">Rated</div>

                <div data-rating="3.7" data-category-sequence="1" data-creative-id="0" data-slot-id="0" data-entity-type="restaurant" data-entity-id="67275" data-ad-position="1" data-ad-zone-id="2027" data-ad-category-id="1" data-banner-id="0" style="" class=" pbot0 res_ad_banner ">

    &lt;div class="ui addressblocker small modal &lt;% if (persistent) { %&gt; persistent-modal &lt;% } %&gt;"&gt;
        &lt;% if (!persistent) { %&gt;
            &lt;i class="close icon"&gt;&lt;/i&gt;

<script type="text/javascript">
            var tdata = tdata || {};tdata["regime"] = "-1";tdata["category"] = "0";tdata["adref"] = "";
            tdata["fbtrack"] = "f26eb8d1a83e6a5d53d20749f7a0d1c9";
            tdata["userid"] = "0";
            tdata["city_id"] = "7";
            tdata["res_id"] = "65499";
            tdata["ref"] = document.referrer;
            tdata["page"] = document.location.href;

            if (typeof(userActionType) == "undefined") {
                var userActionType = "pageview";
            }

            var iscat = getQueryVariable("category", document.referrer);
            if (iscat != -1) {
                tdata["category"] = iscat;
            }

            function trackUserAction(data, type) {
                data["type"] = type;
                var get = "";
                for(i in data) {
                    if(data[i] != "")
                        get += encodeURIComponent(i)+"="+encodeURIComponent(data[i])+"&amp;";
                }
                (function(d, s) {
                    var len = document.querySelectorAll("head &gt; script").length;
                    len = (len &gt; 0) ? len - 1 : 0;
                    var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[len];
                    js = d.createElement(s);
                    js.src = "https://track.zomato.com/php/tracking.php?"+get;
                    js.async = "true";
                    fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
                }(document, "script"));
            }

            function getQueryVariable(variable, query) {
                var query = query.substring(query.indexOf("?") + 1);
                var vars = query.split("&amp;");
                for (var i = 0; i &lt; vars.length; i++) {
                    var pair = vars[i].split("=");
                    if (decodeURIComponent(pair[0]) == variable) {
                        return decodeURIComponent(pair[1]);
                    }
                }
                return -1;
            }

            trackUserAction(tdata, userActionType);
